title: Liverpool's Joel Matip reveals what keeps him up at night as centre-back looks to put AFCON nightmare behind him
text:
Get Liverpool FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
In an interview with BBC One's Football Focus Liverpool defender Joel Matip has revealed making mistakes keeps him up at night. 
After recovering from an initial ankle injury, the former Schalke centre-back got off to an excellent start for the Reds following his free transfer in the summer. 
But the 25-year-old picked up another ankle injury in January and was further ruled out of Liverpool's squad after a squabble with Cameroon. 
Cameroon called up Matip for the Africa Cup of Nations despite the defender claiming he retired in 2015. Joel Matip hasn't played for Cameroon for two years (Photo: Getty) 
Liverpool and Matip were both forced to wait on Fifa's response before he could play. 
Now firmly back in Jurgen Klopp's first team plans, Matip is looking to put a tough month behind him. 
However, the German-born centre-back reveals there will always be one thing that keeps him up at night. Joel Matip is back in Liverpool's first XI (Photo: Nigel Roddis) 
Speaking on Football Focus , he said: "I'm a calm person but sometimes I get angry. 
"The emotions sometimes help but to stay clear in mind will always help. I hate when I make mistakes and sometimes it takes me a long time to sleep.
